doc.headline: State Department spokesman says US condemns bombings that killed and injured many in Jaipur

text.p: The United States condemned terrorist attacks in western India "that have killed and injured many innocent civilians," State Department spokesman Sean McCormack said Tuesday.
He said there was no justification for such killings.
"The United States stands with the government and people of India in their ongoing fight to eliminate the scourge terrorism," McCormack said.
Seven bombs ripped through the city of Jaipur, leaving at least 60 people dead.
